channel.title: Cooking
channel.description:
Alright so im using figmentscape as a base but i have no clue how to change cooking levels i looked through
the client.java but coulden't find anything like you need this level to cook this..
I'm trying to make sharks be 80 cooking but idk how and i know
cooking sharks works because i tested.

item.title: Cooking
item.dc:creator: @Limit101 Limit101
item.description:
@Limit101 wrote:

You think that’s it wtf does cooking=[2] mean then?

Yeah it worked thanks dude i didn’t understand the rest like cooking 2 and all taht.

But how would i change xp now?

Think i got it

Read full topic

item.title: Cooking
item.dc:creator: @Project_Evolution Project Evolution
item.description:
@Project_Evolution wrote:

cooking[1] = 85;

Change it to 80.

Read full topic

item.title: Cooking
item.dc:creator: @Limit101 Limit101
item.description:
@Limit101 wrote:

[code]Ok im adding all with 383

}[/code]

case 383: cooking[1] = 85; cooking[2] = playerLevel[7]; cooking[3] = 387; cooking[4] = 385; cooking[5] = 75; break;

else if(useItemID == 383 && atObjectID == 2732)//cooking shark fire { setAnimation(897); deleteItem(383, getItemSlot(383), 1); addItem(385, 1); addSkillXP(2300*playerLevel[7], 7); sendMessage("You cook a shark"); }

else if(useItemID == 383 && atObjectID == 4172)//cooking shark { setAnimation(883); deleteItem(383, getItemSlot(383), 1); addItem(385, 1); addSkillXP(10000*playerLevel[7], 7); sendMessage("You cook a shark"); }

case 383: //raw shark cooking[1] = 80; cooking[2] = 210; cooking[4] = 385; cooking[6] = 387; break;

All i could find that’s related to 383 (raw shark) and cooking

People said it said nothing at all.

Read full topic
